text: Bottle at Redlight. Hazy golden. Smells of green apples, funky, very acidic. A bit of acetic acid. Tastes of sour apples up front. Not even granny smith. Very sour apples. Vinegar sourness throughout. Not my favorite profile. Tingly sour apple flavor in the finish. Flat, of course. Fascinating but not something Id really go for again.

Bottle - Funky, lemon and some nice apple. Clear hay and no head. Horse blanket, light lemon and some nice acidity. Apple is there, but not in your face and the sweetness comes out in the long finish. Nice.

On tap at Himkok, april 16th 2016. Hazy yellow body, minimal white head. Arima is funky with apples and herbs. Taste is tart and dry, apples, with a mild funk finish. Good lasting sour apple aftertaste. Nice.

Keg @ Palais de La Biere, Lyon. Hazy gold with no head. Musty, earthy nose. Mellow Apple and plenty of funk. Dank basement. Some pissy straw. Flavor is similar. Crisp apple skin. Mildly tart. A touch of clean acid on the finish. A bit of dirt. Medium body, soft carb. Excellent.
On tap. Light straw color. Bit of grape-like aroma. Very dry and tart. Not my cup of tea.
Bottle shared with Paul. Pours a bright golden yellow body. Nose is soft fruit, sugars and light nail polish. Mouthfeel is tart and dry with notes of bright fruit, funk and soft vinegar.

750ml bottle 2/27/15 (Courtesy of TerryR)-Pours a clear light golden with no head. Aroma of apple and vinegar. Taste of the same with a big tartness on the back end. This light bodied beverage is still tasty and rather fulfilling.

A pale blonde cider with a very thin white head. In aroma , a superb mix of Gueuze, horse blanket, Brett, sour apple, beautiful. In mouth, a nice tart cider with wild yeast, Brett, horse blanket, lactic acid, very nice, smooth, complex, and pleasing. Bottle at Six Ten, Tampa.
Pours clear pale yellow color with no head. Aromas of tart green apples. Sour green apple flavor with some mustiness. Medium body with no carbonation.
Sampled during RBSG. From notes. Tart and funky. Green apples and a little barnyard.
Bottle from The Davis Beer Shoppe. Pours hazy gold. Aroma is slightly tart apple. Med minus body. It is very dry, has a certain tartness, and tastes of apples and wood. Finishes quite dry. Good.

Refrigerated 75 cl green bottle with screw off top poured into a glass. Clear straw no head, medium body, no carbonation, and no lacing. Aroma is light tang, and taste is light tart, some oak, some apple. Pretty good cider, better as it warms.

750 ml bottle, 30.04.15-5 stamped on the back label. Served in a Prairie Teku glass, the cider pours a hazy straw gold color with pretty much no head at all. It smells like green apples, oak and some funk. I think the taste is similar to the aroma, but theres also some earthiness and lemon peel noticeable. Mouthfeel/body is light/medium, its a bit coating with low carbonation. I admit that I havent tried many ciders, but I liked this one. Its nice and tart, and also enjoyable. $10.99 a bottle.

Bottle at home. Pours lightly cloudy yellow with small effervescent bubbles, though no head forms. Aroma is earthy, barnyard and tart apples and yeast. Flavor is lightly tart apples, funky yeast and a dry finish. Light body and carbonation.

In short: A pale Sidra with strong funk. Funky!
How: From the wood barrel at Sagardoetxea, Astigarraga Spain.
The look: Cloudy yellow-ish body with almost no head.
To me a typical Sidra is: Funky aroma of medium intensity with many light color fruits in the back (not just apples). Body is medium in size, a texture that is both juicy and doughy and with minimal carbonation. Taste is a lot less apple-forward than a regular cider with apples but also various light color tropical/citrus/exotic fruits. Yeast presence accompanied by a bready sensation. Typical Sidras have a mild sourness and ends with a mild-medium acidic bite. Thirst quenching and also a bit nourishing. 
In long: Paler color than the typical Sidra with flavors that are mostly as above except with a stronger funk presence, and I love funk. A funky Sidra is basically like an infected regular cider, and I just love infection, theres not a single penis enlargement weblink I havent clicked.
Bottle at DC Epic Sour Tasting 2014. Cloudy pale yellow color. Aroma of funky sour apple flesh and skins. Taste is softly sour and fruity. Delicious.

This cider here, this cider I had @ the Grand Tasting.... 
Pours very hazy, very pale, & very still.

The aroma is earthy with plenty of tart fruit. Its got a bit of apple character and a lot of dusty cellar type of stuff going on. 

The flavor is super tart, almost bracingly (but enjoyably) acidic. Its got a fair amount of apple skin, and apple flesh with some earthy minerallity. 

Pretty cool stuff.

Bottle @ RBSG 2014 Grand Tasting. Hazed straw pour with a white head. Funky, sour aroma. Lots of lemon and green apple. Somewhat leathery. Flavor is quite sour. Mild apple sweetness and a hint of pear. Plenty of lemon, green grapes, and a leathery funk. Slight cobweb. Refreshing.
Sample at SRBG Grand Tasting 2014. Pours a cloudy pale gold with a small white head. Aroma of apples and funk. Taste is green apples, funk, grapes, and grass. Very nice cider.

Sampled at the RBSG14 Grand Tasting - Pours pale yellow with a small white head. The aroma has semi-sweet apples, candy notes and richness - nice. It has a medium light clean body with nice semi-sharp carbonation. The flavor has a balance of sweetness and tartness and is very clean and refreshing. Solid cider.
Bottle. RBSG. Grand Tasting. Pours cloudy yellow with white head. Nose/taste of apple crisp, tart apple and oak. Medium body.
750ml wine-style green bottle. Lighter pour, heavy sour apple scent. Funkir sourness in the flavor, very tart, tannic, and acidic.

Bottle. Pours a clear pale yellow with a white head that dissipates completely. Aroma has a nice combination of dry apple and a bit of tartness. Flavor starts with a slight sweet apple but really is full of a nice tartness with a hint of dryness.

Tepid murky lemon. Huge Granny Smith nose, skin and flesh, lightly sugary. More balanced flavor is honey and green apple, sticky light grass and grape sweetness mid, moderate acid through sticky, doughy finish with more skin sourness balancing. Quenching and crisp with enough dryness to temper the sweeter grape notes, #1 amidst 40+ US sours in the same day.
Bottle (2012) shared at DC Annual Epic Sour Tasting. Hazy light yellow with no head. Aromas of apples, light funk. Tastes of apples, light tart, light funk. Medium-light body with a dry finish.
From a bottle shared at the DC Epic Sour Beer Tasting. Pours a clear gold with a feint off white head. Delicate flavor of tart green apples. Dry finish.
Bottle. Poured a totally hazy yellow color with not a huge head, mostly wispy. Aroma was light apples, some tartness. Flavor was clean, enjoyable tart apples. Nice and tasty.

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2014 75 cL bottle from Beer Run, 12/14/13. This is the 1000th brewery I have rated. Poured from about 2.5 feet. Pours a hazy pale orange color with a thin wisp of white fizzy head. Aroma of tart apples with some barnyard and earth. The taste is tart, dry apples with pepper and an earthy finish. Medium bodied, lingering tartness, low carbonation, refreshing. This bottle will be emptied quickly. Very nice cider.

750ml bottle, shared by Jay. Pours a paler yellow color. Minimal white head, even with an aggressive pour. Very interesting funky flavor, kind of gueuzy, I like that. Jay tells me this is because its brewed with natural yeast, very cool. Some apple of course. Light tart taste, moderate sweet. Medium body, good smooth very light carbonation, more dry finish. Enjoyable, unique, tart funky complex cider. Much better than expected.

750mL from P St Whole Foods in DC. Pours low carbonation, fizzing out white soda foam. Beautifully bright glowing straw pour with green highlights. Nose is pretty funky off the bat: some crazy moldy peach, ripened pithy papaya, fresh and tropical like a passionfruit Berliner Weisse. Taste is holy monkey sour, bracing citric tang with fresh strawberry acid, pomelo pulp, strawberry limeade. Quenching, refreshing. Quick, lactic lemonade finish. Extremely light bodied. Really awesome. My first Basque sidra I think and I will now be on a quest for more!

Bottle. Pours with a hazy pale yellow hued body with a quick to fade white head. Aromas are of light funk, lactic acid, sulfur, tannic apples, light barnyard, earth, black pepper and sage. Flavors are quite tart, acidic, strong green apple, huge apple tannin, with moderate earthy funk. Nearly lemon juice acidity. Balance is a little bit skewed, but still quite tasty. Moderate to bubbly carbonation, puckering and a thin body.

750 ml bottle to snifter (6% abv; shared with the Mrs.). Looks solid; a mostly transparent gold with soft carbonation and razor-thin white lacing that dissipates quickly. Smells and tastes like weak cider with an average (at best), fairly tart mouthfeel. An absolute ripoff that I would not buy again. $10.99/750 ml; U jokin r wat?
Bottle from Proof. Light yellow pour with almost no head. Aroma is tart funk and apple. Tastes are moderately tart, earthy, sweet apple. Finishes dry. Kind of one dimensional, but very nice.

Bright pale gold, perfectly clear, poured from a height of 2 it produced an inch of rapidly fading fizzy white foam. Clean aromas of orchard apples, light must and cheese rind from the wild yeast. Firmly tart, sour green apple, cheese rind, dry new oak. Juicy and drinkable. Very light trace funk, a good intro Basque cider.

Shared thanks to scitchzi! Pours a hazy yellow from the bottle with no real head or lacing. Aroma of sour apple funk, nice sweetness. Taste follows, like a sour cider with a mild finish. Very nice, a cider I can drink.
75cl bottle from sagardo denda. Color is golden. Head is thin. Body is quite soft. Aroma is citric, pineapple, apple, pepper and brett. Taste is medium sour and bitter.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2013 750mL screw top bottle purchased at Binnys ($10). Poured into an Isastegi Basque cider glass. Very hazy pee yellow in color, no head of course (I tried the traditional method of pouring but I was afraid to go deep). Aroma is only mildly sweet apple, very light like a slightly sweet Granny Smith. That has the tart aspect, lactic (milky tart). Nice long tart finish on the aroma. Flavor is very tart in the finish. Lots of musky apple yet all dry with a mineral feel from the a stronger than expected carbonation. Long tart Granny Smith apple. Light feel to the thing. My first French Basque cider and its ust awesome.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Bottle shared by beastiefan2k - thanks, Eugene! - hazy light gold, moderate effervescence - nose is tart, mildly lactic, moderately phenolic, with a mild background fruit skin funkiness - very tart and quenching flavor - mostly dry, with just a light apple sweetness through the middle - tangy lactic tang before a bone dry, lightly funky finish - nice cider.
500ml bottle @RLRL-white ring-hazy yellow.  A-lacto, apple skin-tart.  T-lacto, apple skin-tart.

Pours a hazy yellow. Aroma of lacto, apples and sweet honey. Taste is tart and fruity. Very nice

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle courtesy of Max at Andys New Years Eve party/tasting/Fluxx tournament.  Pours a slightly hazed gold with touches of a white head.  Soft apples on the nose, slightly dry and funky.  Sweet but it dries out very quickly. Nice soft funkiness, acid, muskiness.  Very interesting, dry and almost bretty at the end with a  touch of smokiness.  Sweetness comes back long after the finish.  Liked this a bunch.

from stainless steel


nose - 
must: mild egg-shell, estuary
apple: subtle

flavor - 
must: medium-low
apple: lightly sweet, juice-like
bitterness: medium, skin-like astringency
acid: medium
other: lower carbonation than most others, so a bit flabby
